title: What is the relationship between esotericism and morality in the traditional world?
first_phrase: In this final 200 tokens, the text explores the idea that traditional morality did not exist in the ancient world as it was based on divine law and connection to a transcendent order. This idea has been lost with the humanization of history, leading to the formation of a self-justified morality that dominates today. This inversion occurred in religion, particularly in Christianity, where morality came to dominate over the traditional view of ritual. The text then goes on to explore the esoteric view on this matter.

last_phrase: In conclusion, esotericism relies on knowledge and understanding of causal relationships. Human beings are capable of making their own decisions and taking responsibility for their actions, without the need for fear or external guidance. By understanding the laws of cause and effect, individuals can regulate their conduct and expect the consequences of their actions. In this way, esotericism offers a practical and personalized approach to morality.
